Expectation1: Secure packages and confirm successful delivery
Situation1: Leaving a package safely at the doorstep when no one is home
Situation2: They encounter a situation where a friend is being treated unfairly and feel a stronger responsibility to intervene or speak up.
Story: I balanced the package in my hands, scanning the quiet street for any sign of the customer. As a delivery person, my job was clear: leave the parcel safely at the doorstep, snap a photo, and move on. But as I approached the house, I saw my friend Raj standing at the edge of the yard, his face tense. Two men were arguing with him, voices sharp, accusing him of something he didn’t do. My heart pounded. As a Hindu, I was taught to stand up for dharma, to act with integrity and protect others from injustice. But my phone buzzed with a reminder—deliveries were timed, and I couldn’t risk a failed drop. If I intervened, I might miss the delivery window, risking my job. If I walked away, I’d betray my values and my friend. The package felt heavier in my hands as I stood frozen, torn between my duty to my work and my duty to what I believed was right.
